service_summary.title: Service Summary
service_summary.description: A brief description of a specific technical or access service offered, such as the use of X to investigate Y

service_readiness_level.title: Service Readiness Level
service_readiness_level.description: This scale is directly based on the standard - Technology readiness levels (TRLs), adapted for heritage science, which are a method for estimating the maturity of the services being offered. For more details see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technology_readiness_level

service_operating_languages.title: Operating Languages
service_operating_languages.description: What languages can the team operate in or what language is a tool presented in

description.title: Description of the support
description.description: General description of the support or any required caption/citation

service_techniques.title: Service Techniques
service_techniques.description: A list of the individual relevant heritage science examination and analytical techniques carried out within this Service - selected from a publicly defined controlled list. This free text option will need to be replaced with a controlled list.

offered_to.title: Offered to
offered_to.description: At what level are accesses available

service_application_required.title: Service application required
service_application_required.description: Is an application for access required

provider_id.title: Provider ID
provider_id.description: Please provide a resolvable PID for the provider such as a ORCID (https://orcid.org/) for a person or a ROR (https://ror.org/) for a Research Organisation. Specific E-RIHS provider IDs may also be used were required.

provider_roles.title: Provider Roles
provider_roles.description: This value should be replaced with a controlled list

national_node.title: National Node - Proposer
national_node.description: The URL for the PID for the National Node who proposed this service.

contact_id.title: Contact ID
contact_id.description: Please provide a contact PID, this may be an internal reference or an external PID such as an ORCID.

contact_email.title: Contact Email
contact_email.description: If internal references are used this data can be stored there, if external IDs are used a specific email address may be required.

service_description.title: Service Description
service_description.description: A longer description of a specific technical or access service offered within the IPERION-HS project or under E-RIHS

research_disciplines.title: Research Disciplines
research_disciplines.description: Which domains or disciplines has a given service worked within, has experience within.

service_categories.title: Service Categories
service_categories.description: An externally defined service top level categories defining what types of work the included techniques are used to carry out - selected from a publicly defined controlled list.

service_functions.title: Service Functions
service_functions.description: An externally defined service practical level activity, what has a service been used for, what is it intended for.

service_equipment_tools.title: Service Equipment or Tools
service_equipment_tools.description: Service equipment should be defined by PIDs and represent the specific pieces of equipment and or tools used within the service - detail of setup, methodology, procedures, etc. should all be attached directly to the equipment records.

service_resources.title: Collections, Objects, Samples and Archives
service_resources.description: Service resources should be defined by PIDs and represent the heritage collections, objects, samples, archives, other research resources directly provided by the service.

service_limitations.title: Service Limitations
service_limitations.description: This section may need to be more complex but it might be simplified to a controlled list with optional related values – Does it work on samples or complete objects – will it damaged or destroy samples – what are the size limitations on samples or objects – are the results of other examination required – do the input samples/objects/files need to be prepared or formatted in a specific way – the full extent of this will need to be discussed.

team_member_id.title: Person ID
team_member_id.description: Please provide a resolvable PID for the provider such as a ORCID (https://orcid.org/).

team_member_roles.title: Person Roles
team_member_roles.description: This value should be replaced with a controlled list

team_member_start_date.title: Joined Service
team_member_start_date.description: A simple date to indicate when a given person joined the team working on a given service.

link_url.description: A related resolvable URL not covered by the other fields

link_type.description: Please note people currently involved in providing the service should be listed with in the Service Team section.

service_version.title: Service Version
service_version.description: Service develop over time with changes of equipment, software, personnel, etc. Version numbers should be changed to indicate these changes - please note very large scale changes may warrant the creation of a new Service record to clarify differences in the data or results created.

service_version_date.title: Service Version Date
service_version_date.description: The version date is the date from which this particular version of this Service was offered in a formal capacity by the defined Access provider.

service_creation_date.title: Service Creation Date
service_creation_date.description: The creation date is the date from which this particular Service was offered in a formal capacity by the defined Access provider.

service_dmp.title: Service Data Management Plan
service_dmp.description: Link to an open description of the data management procedures followed with the defined service, including licence issues, preferred data repositories, publication embargoes, common file formats, software and systems used, etc.

service_dmp_variation.title: Variation from E-RIHS DMP
service_dmp_variation.description: Link to an open description of any required data management differences that may be required for the service, in relation to national, funding or institutional limitations – some differences could be easily manageable but other might require updates to the E-RIHS DMP.

service_output.title: Service Output Description
service_output.description: A link to a formatted extract from the DMP for ease of use: A description of all of the raw and processes outputs created by a given services including details of how they relate to or rely on each other.

service_input.title: Service Input Description
service_input.description: A link to a formatted extract from the DMP for ease of use: A description of the required formats or files required for any service which processes existing data.

service_further_comments.title: Other Comments
service_further_comments.description: Free text opportunity to advocate for what is novel or special about this particular access

service_keywords.title: Service keywords
service_keywords.description: Additional terms and concepts not covered by the other fields, it would be good to reference these to some form of open vocabulary

service_access_unit.title: Service Access Period Unit
service_access_unit.description: For previously defined services this has commonly been defined in days or occasionally hours - but with the development of digital services additional smaller time units might be needed.

service_access_count.title: Service Annual Access Count
service_access_count.description: For new services this would need to be based on past experience of the provider if applicable, or related to the relevant resources that can be provided. For automated digital tools this count could be based on previous use metrics or estimated in relation to the planned dissemination plan. For running services this count could represent and average of the recorded value for the previous year - a record of the count for each year should be stored.

service_hours_per_unit.title: Service Access Hours per Unit
service_hours_per_unit.description: Accesses Units are describe as time periods, but depending on the nature of a service this might relate to a range of different periods of activity time. For example a day could relate to a working day or a calendar day, a digital service could relate to run time or processing time. So this value is used to relate actual activity time to the recorded access unit..

checked_date.title: Checked Date
checked_date.description: When was the description of the service last checked

service_active.title: Active service
service_active.description: Is the service currently open for access?
